replies.bodyText:
I agree, but we have several other raw get() calls here, so it seems better to be consistent. Hiding it in this way is kind of a code smell -- it would be better to see if the code can be structured to avoid this. Maybe by creating some helper classes to hold the state.
In Java 10+, get() should be replaced with orElseThrow() to be explicit.

replies.author: findepi

replies.bodyText:
I'd like to phase out support for JKS. My feeling is that users don't want JKS, they just use it because they have to or because they don't realize (and the documentation doesn't say) that they can use PEM files.
If we need to support it later, we'll deprecate this and switch to the other name style. Regarding tls vs ssl, I chose ssl since that matches the majority of existing configs and language used in the documentation.

replies.author: findepi

replies.bodyText: It turns out that in Java 8, the JDK code assumes that createSocket is implemented on the passed in class name (it looks it up reflectively), and that the factory returned from getDefault() is of the same class. The Java 11 code works as expected by casting to SocketFactory and simply calling the method.
